title: Starlink’s survivability in war a good sign for DoD’s future constellation
summary: SDA Director Derek Tournear said Starlink's performance so far speaks to the power of a proliferated constellation to deter attacks and provide resilience

title: Progress MS-21 to launch to ISS on resupply mission
summary: Roscosmos is scheduled to launch Progress MS-21 atop a Soyuz-2.1a rocket from the Baikonur Cosmodrome, in Kazakhstan, at 8:20 PM EDT on Oct. 25 (00:20 UTC on Oct. 26). After launching from Site 31/6 in Baikonur, Roscosmos plans to have the Progress MS-21 spacecraft conduct a standard two-day autonomous rendezvous with the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Array Labs raises $5 million for 3D-imagery constellation
summary: Silicon Valley startup Array Labs raised $5 million in a pre-seed funding round backed by Seraphim Space and Agya Ventures, a real estate technology fund.

title: Russian cargo ship arrives at launch pad for flight to space station
summary: Russia is set to launch a Progress supply freighter Tuesday on a two-day trek to the International Space Station to deliver 5,556 pounds (2,520 kilograms) of cargo, fuel, air and water to the orbiting research laboratory. A Soyuz booster will launch the Progress cargo ship at 8:20 p.m. EDT Tuesday (0020 GMT Wednesday) from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan.

title: The ISS has had to maneuver yet again from Russian satellite debris
summary: This fragment was one of more than 1,500 pieces of debris from Cosmos 1408.

title: Orbit Fab secures new investor to support satellite refueling efforts
summary: Orbit Fab, a startup developing infrastructure for in-space refueling of satellites, announced Oct. 25 it lined up a new investor to support those plans.

title: China’s spaceplane raises orbit and national funding
summary: A spaceplane launched by China in August has performed an orbit-raising maneuver and recently secured new funding to promote new modes of transportation.

title: Polaris Dawn crewed mission could suffer additional delays
summary: A billionaire-backed private astronaut mission on a SpaceX Crew Dragon has slipped from late this year to March 2023 and could be further delayed, in part for issues beyond its control.

title: Sending DNA-infused Space Crystals to the moon
summary: Space Crystals plans to send crystals grown in microgravity and infused with customer DNA to the moon next year.

title: Final two Pléiades Neo imagery satellites land in French Guiana
summary: The last two high-resolution imaging satellites for Airbus Defence and Space’s Pléiades Neo constellation have arrived in French Guiana ahead of their launch next month.
